message.content:
cs.CV, cs.RO, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.GR 

This paper deals with the problem of selective weeding in agriculture using robotics. It proposes a novel approach to generate synthetic training datasets for detection and classification algorithms. The approach involves procedurally generating large synthetic datasets by randomizing key features of the target environment. This paper is likely to belong to the Computer Vision (cs.CV) sub-category as it deals with image segmentation and classification. It also involves Robotics (cs.RO) as it deals with the use of robots in agriculture. Machine Learning (cs.LG) and Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) are also likely sub-categories as the paper proposes a data-driven approach to solve the problem. Finally, Graphics (cs.GR) is a possible sub-category as the paper involves rendering synthetic images.
